poem:
**Pigs at the Gate**

Two pigs,  
winged in ambition,  
leave their muddy roots  
for air-bound delight,  
don masks of men  
at the terminal's threshold—  
a dance of pink,  
in improbable flight—  
hooves on tiles,  
snouts in smiles,  
as they board  
the world's  
whimsy-bound  
jetstream.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Pigs Fly Easy Ryan review – a frisky, filthy cabaret of chaos It is probably best not to ask too many questions. I mean, you could imagine Lou Doyle and Trevor White wanted their show to be about achieving the impossible and alighted on the phrase “pigs might fly” to encapsulate their vision. That would explain a scenario in which two animals leave their pigsty, disguise themselves as human beings, get past the check-in desks". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
